The trip via dinosaur does indeed make the trip faster than it ordinarily
w=
ould have been. Not because they are necessarily faster overall, since they=

were definitely slow movers, but in this rough and uneven terrain they mad=
e
better speed then either of the two Maximals could have. Also most predat=
ors
give these large Stegosauruses a wide berth!

However one disadavantage=
 of being so large is the almost constant need to
feed, which the creatures=
 do as they walk. Their large frames knocking over
small trees or propping =
up on the larger ones. What this means for the
Maximals is that their path =
to the Predacon base is not going to be a
straight one as the dinos detour =
to grab morsels of food, quench thier
thirst or investigate an interesting =
smell along the way.

In the distance the Maximals can hear the sounds of o=
ther large creatures,
some of them the dinosaurs, but others are from the l=
arger mammals that have
appeared - saber toothed cats and other larger and =
deadly predators.

As time passes the Maximals' internal compasses began to=
 chirp in alarm as
the creatures they were riding are began to veer off the=
 course. They were
travelling more south than the east they needed to go.

=
As more time passed they came to what looked to have been an old river bed,=

and in the distance a heard of Stegosaurus were walking, or should we so
p=
lodding, their trip taking them to the south, evidently on some migratory
t=
rail. They were no longer going in the direction that the Maximals needed
t=
o be travelling. However one good thing was that they were no in more open
=
country, the large plains beckoned before them. The Maximals had many more
=
miles to travel before they arrived at their destination, but at least they=

could see where they were going . . . but then again that means that any
p=
redators could see them coming as well.

(TAG)

OOC: Yup, if you haven=92t =
guessed yet I am having fun with this trip, since
it is a long trip and we =
have a battle going on at the same time. I don=92t
want them to leave the b=
attle and travel thousands of miles and get back
before its over. The time =
lines wouldn=92t really match up and it wouldnt
really make sense.

Enjoy

=
Preston

--0022152d7e93a128e504a0f952b8
